com.caseybrooks.androidbibletools.basic

Class Bible<T extends Book>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.caseybrooks.androidbibletools.basic.Bible<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Bible>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ABSBible, CJBBible, SimpleBible

    public abstract class Bible<T extends Book>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Bible>
    A base class to give a verse the Bible translation or version that it is. A basic Bible should have a full name, an abbreviation (which can be derived from the full name), and a list of Books from which we can determine exactly where in the Bible a verse exists.

      • setId

        public void setId(java.lang.String id)
        Most implementations of Bibles have some concept of an Id. This may be a key needed to retrieve its text from a webservice, or its primary key to look it up in a local databaseRegardless of how it is used, it is simpler to keep this in the base class since it is such a common use case.
        Parameters:
        id - the id to set

      • serialize

        public java.lang.String serialize()
        Serialize this Bible into a string that can be used to restore this Bible from persistent memory. Should serialize only that which is necessary to be able to identify this Bible and download the rest of the information. This would typically be the fully qualified class name of this Bible, and any IDs/API keys necessary.
        Returns:
        serialized String representation

      • deserialize

        public void deserialize(java.lang.String string)
        deserialize this Bible from String.
        See Also:
        serialize()

      • parseBook

        public T parseBook(java.lang.String bookName)
        Attemps to parse a given String and determine the name of the book. Failing to find it within the specified books, return nothing, so that the user can either create a blank Book to use instead, throw an exception, or anything else.
        Parameters:
        bookName - the text of the book to attempt to parse
        Returns:
        a Book if the name matches one of the Books in this Bible, null otherwise

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Bible another)

        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Bible>
